clinical_study.brief_title: Magic Shave Powder Gold's Affects on the Occurrence of Pseudofolliculitis Barbae
clinical_study.official_title: Depilatory Cream's Affect on the Occurrence of Pseudofolliculitis Barbae

brief_summary.textblock: Comparing the amount of papules, macules, pustules, and irritation caused by pseudofolluculitis barbae in subjects using depilatory cream versus traditional shaving methods.

detailed_description.textblock: Comparing an experimental group that will remove facial hair with magic shave powder gold, and a control group that will continue using traditional shaving methods. Both the subject and a physician will make observations to determine the efficacy of depilatory creams in reducing pseudofolliculits barbae.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Comparing an experimental to control group
study_design_info.masking_description: Single blinded study where investigator does not know what method of facial hair removal subjects have used

primary_outcome.description: Difference in the investigator assessment of lesions and irritation at baseline and 12 weeks, measured by investigator. The scale title is Investigator Global Assessment, the minimum value is 0, the maximum is 5. Higher scores mean worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.description: Difference in the investigator assessment of disease symptoms at baseline and 12 weeks, measured by patient. The scale title is Patient Global Assessment, the minimum value is 0, the maximum is 5. Higher scores mean worse outcome.

arm_group.description: This group will receive magic shaving powder gold and instructions on how to apply it. They will keep a log for their facial hair removal
This group will continue using traditional razors with the standard of care directions to shave. They will keep a log of their facial hair removal

intervention.description: Depilatory Cream for facial hair removal
Continued facial hair removal using traditional razors

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male
- PFB patient
Exclusion Criteria:
- Failed sensitivity testing
